com.xing.api.data

Class SafeCalendar

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Calendar
      • java.util.GregorianCalendar
        • com.xing.api.data.SafeCalendar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<java.util.Calendar>

    public final class SafeCalendar
extends java.util.GregorianCalendar
    A safer implementation of Calendar. The reason for this class is that Calendar fills all un-set fields calling the internal method Calendar.complete(), which results in unexpected behavior. This implementation overrides Calendar.complete() by scanning the stack trace to ensure that compile() is called only once during the object initialization.

    DISCLAIMER: Although this class is Serializable there is no guaranty that it will be serialized/de-serialized properly.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SafeCalendar()
      Creates an empty calendar, all the fields are not set.
      SafeCalendar(int year)
      Creates a calendar with only year set.
      SafeCalendar(int year, int month)
      Creates a calendar with only year and month set.
      SafeCalendar(int year, int month, int day)
      Creates a calendar with year, month and day set.
      SafeCalendar(int year, int month, int day, int hour, int minute)
      Creates a calendar with year, month, day, hour and minute set.
      SafeCalendar(int year, int month, int day, int hour, int minute, int second)
      Creates a calendar with year, month, day, hour, minute and seconds set.
      SafeCalendar(java.util.Locale locale)
      Creates a calendar with the desired local.
      SafeCalendar(java.util.TimeZone timezone)
      Creates a calendar with the desired local.
      SafeCalendar(java.util.TimeZone timezone, java.util.Locale locale)
      Creates a calendar with the desired local and time zone.

      • complete

        protected void complete()

        We hack the complete method to avoid it being executed by most methods, which can make the calendar data unstable and unreliable.

        Overrides:
        complete in class java.util.Calendar
